page.title: 12Interview with Mr. Ager
page.content: Mr. Ager was a pupil at this school between{1923 and 1929}and he told us a lot about it. In those days there was only the old part of the school in use but there were about a 100 children there. It must have been very crowded because the children stayed there until they were fourteen. There was one big stove which the teacher stood in front of (we can still see the marks on the floor). Mr. Ager brought in a school photograph from the time and all the boys were wearing shorts and hob nailed boots. There was no school field and much less playground than there is now. The toilets were all outside and they were only buckets and there was no water - it had to be fetched. There were two teachers and two pupil teachers; our headteacher's aunt was one of these at the time.
